DOC.brief_summary: This phase 2/3 , randomize , open-label , active control , multi-center study assess safety efficacy solithromycin child adolescent community-acquired bacterial pneumonia ( CABP ) .
DOC.brief_title: Safety Efficacy Solithromycin Adolescents Children With Community-acquired Bacterial Pneumonia
DOC.criteria: History and/or document fever ( rectal , ear , oral temperature ≥38°C axillary temperature ≥37.5°C ) hypothermia ( rectal , ear , oral temperature < 35°C axillary temperature < 34.5°C ) Chest radiograph infiltrate consistent bacterial pneumonia ( pneumonia cause atypical bacterial agent ) ; subject outpatient start oral therapy , radiograph require . Presence least 2 follow sign symptom : Cough Difficulty breathe Production purulent sputum Chest pain Grunting Hypotension Tachycardia , define follow : 2 month < 24 month : ≥160 beats/min 24 month < 10 year : ≥140 beats/min 10 year : ≥100 beats/min Tachypnea , define follow : 2 month < 12 month : ≥50 breaths/min 12 month < 5 year : ≥40 breaths/min 5 year : ≥20 breaths/min Physical exam consistent pulmonary consolidation Presence least 1 follow : Leukocytosis ( ≥12,000 white blood cell [ WBC ] /mm3 ) Leukopenia ( < 5000 WBC/mm3 ) ≥10 % immature neutrophil ( band ) regardless total peripheral WBC Elevated inflammatory marker ( Creactive protein procalcitonin ) Oxygen saturation < 97 % room air Organism consistent typical respiratory pathogen identify Ventilatorassociated hospitalacquired pneumonia > 48 hour systemic antibacterial therapy confirm suspected bacterial meningitis breastfeed female positive pregnancy test
